title: Transfer Vehicle Registration
text_content:
Upon the death of a registered motor vehicle owner, the vehicle registration and license plates remain valid until:
the end of the current registration period; or
the survivor of the vehicle owner transfers the title; or
the executor or administrator transfers the ownership of the vehicle.
If you inherit the vehicle and plan to register it in Virginia, you must:
Complete Section C of the Vehicle Title Certificate
Complete and submit an Application for Registration (
VSA 14
)
Pay a vehicle registration fee, which is based on the weight of the vehicle
